when you say bandwidth, you mean an allocated quota per time period, or shaping ?
for traffic shaping you want to look into iptables, but you'll probably want a graphical user interface configuration tool ... (anyone know any ..?)

If you're looking at traffic filtering ... squid (a caching proxy server, which can also help to save total bandwidth) is also capable of filtering traffic by URI, and iptables rules can limit particular hosts/ports too
before you install anything ... starting reading and googling - have a look at the Ubuntu Server stuff
you do need a script, but firestarter will help you to write it (behind the scenes)
